iiv.display

Class IntensityProjectionImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • iiv.display.DisplayComponent
            • iiv.display.SingleImg
              • iiv.display.IntensityProjectionImage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CNUTypesConstants, CoordinateMappable, ScaleInterface, LocationMapping, NumberFormattable, Overlayable, ShowPointImage, SliceNumbering, Croppable, FilterSampling, Flippable, Rotatable, Zoomable, CNUFileObject, iiVScriptable, ShowStatus, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class IntensityProjectionImage
extends SingleImg
implements CNUTypesConstants
    Component to display a maximum intensity projection of CNUData as an image with flip, zoom and show point abilities.
    Since:
    iiV1.117a
    See Also:
    CNUViewer, Container, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntensityProjectionImage

        public IntensityProjectionImage(CNUData inImg,
                                int sliceViewMode,
                                int firstslice,
                                int lastslice,
                                int iValue,
                                CNUScale sc)
        Constructs a new instance of IntensityProjectionImage.
        Parameters:
        inImg - the data to retrieve image pixels from
        sliceViewMode - the slice orientation to display CNUDimensions.TRANSVERSE, CNUDimensions.CORONAL, CNUDimensions.SAGITTAL,,,
        firstslice - slice number in the range from 0 to the number of slices for the sliceViewMode. Intensity projection includes values only from firstslice to lastslice.
        lastslice - the slice number in the range from 0 to the number of slices for the sliceViewMode. If less than 0 last slice for mode used instead.
        iValue - the 4th or i dimension to use for displaying a slice from 4 dimensional data
        sc - the scale object for mapping pixel values to indices in the color lookup table

      • IntensityProjectionImage

        public IntensityProjectionImage(CNUData inImg,
                                int sliceViewMode,
                                int firstslice,
                                int lastslice,
                                int iValue,
                                CNUScale sc,
                                double factor)
        Constructs a new instance of IntensityProjectionImage.
        Parameters:
        inImg - the data to retrieve image pixels from
        sliceViewMode - the slice orientation to display CNUDimensions.TRANSVERSE, CNUDimensions.CORONAL, CNUDimensions.SAGITTAL...
        firstslice - slice number in the range from 0 to the number of slices for the sliceViewMode. Intensity projection includes values only from firstslice to lastslice.
        lastslice - the slice number in the range from 0 to the number of slices for the sliceViewMode. If less than 0 last slice for mode used instead.
        iValue - the 4th or i dimension to use for displaying a slice from 4 dimensional data
        sc - the scale object for mapping pixel values to indices in the color lookup table
        factor - if factor less than 0, creates minimum intensity projections.

      • findGreaterValues

        public static final int findGreaterValues(java.lang.Object inArray,
                                          int inOffset,
                                          int inType,
                                          int[] inInc,
                                          java.lang.Object outArray,
                                          int outOffset,
                                          int[] outDims,
                                          int currentDim,
                                          int[] indiceSaveArray,
                                          int indice,
                                          double factor)
        Searches a multi-dimensional square region from one data array to fill a lesser dimensional array with peaks. The amount of data searched is governed by the array of output dimensions. The output array is filled from the output offset with no word skipping. Uses a recursive routine - calling this routine to recurse to lower dimensions until lowest dimension (currentDim = 0) is reached and then calling compare fill.
        Parameters:
        inArray - input data array
        inOffset - location of input array to begin copying from
        inType - CNU data type of input array
        inInc - array containing one increment for each dimension. The increments specify the number of words to the next input word for the same dimension.
        outArray - output data array
        outOffset - location of output array to begin copying to
        outDims - array of output dimensions which governs the amount of data copied for each dimension
        currentDim - index of dimension recursive routine is currently working with
        indiceSaveArray - int array to store indice where values are replaced
        indice - indice value to store
        factor - if negative factor array filled with valleys instead of peaks.
        Returns:
        the offset to the next location in the output array.

      • findGreaterInArray

        public static final void findGreaterInArray(java.lang.Object inarray,
                                            int inoffset,
                                            int intype,
                                            int inInc,
                                            java.lang.Object outarray,
                                            int outoffset,
                                            int cnt,
                                            int[] indiceSaveArray,
                                            int indice,
                                            double factor)
        Compares an array of values to another array replacing the second with greater values and noting the current indice in yet another array when a replacement is done. Data from the input array can be undersampled or reverse sampled by specifying an in increment other then one.
        Parameters:
        inarray - input data array
        inoffset - location of input array to begin compares
        intype - CNU data type of input array
        inInc - amount to increment to get to the next input word after comparing
        outarray - output data array
        outoffset - location of output array to begin compare
        cnt - number of words to compare
        indiceSaveArray - int array to store indice where values are replaced
        indice - indice value to store
        factor - if negative factor values replaced with lesser instead of greater.

      • getIndicesFromNonfilteredPoint

        public int[] getIndicesFromNonfilteredPoint(java.awt.Point pt)
        Gets the indices corresponding to the original raw data this display component is created from based on a point relative to the non-filtered (no flip, rotation, zoom, or offset) image.
        Overrides:
        getIndicesFromNonfilteredPoint in class SingleImg
        Parameters:
        pt - point to get indice for
        Returns:
        the indices to the data

      • getNonfilteredPoint

        public java.awt.Point getNonfilteredPoint(int[] indices)
        Gets the point relative to the non-filtered (no flip, rotation, zoom, or offset) image given the indices corresponding to the original raw data this display component is created from. This default implementation returns the indices stored in a Point object.
        Overrides:
        getNonfilteredPoint in class SingleImg
        Parameters:
        indices - indices to original raw data which may have any number of dimensions
        Returns:
        location relative to non-filtered image (negative value for x or y indicates the indice doesn't map to that dimension)

        public boolean onImage(int[] indices)
        Determines if the given indices relative to the raw data are located on the display image.
        Overrides:
        onImage in class SingleImg
        Parameters:
        indices - indices to original raw data which may have any number of dimensions
        Returns:
        true if indices are located on the image this component represents.
